title: Codice Fiscale
information: The Codice Fiscale is a tax code unique to each person. It is required for many things, including getting a Permesso di Soggiorno, signing the contract with the academy or with your landlord, or even for joining a gym.

steps.title: Book an appointment
steps.text:
Book an appointment either online or through the app. If you can't make the appointment, remember to cancel it. Note that the English and German versions of the website are different to the Italian one.
Book or cancel an appointment on the website: 
Use the translate service built into Safari or Google Translate to navigate the booking.

Required documents:
 - Completed form

title: Permesso di Soggiorno
information: Permesso di Soggiorno (temporary residence permit) gives permission for non-EU citizens to stay legally in Italy if they intend to live here for more than three months. Since the Academy course lasts longer than three months, it is a requirement. The permit should be requested within 8 work days of arriving to Italy (excluding Sundays and public holidays).  (<- or 90...?)

steps.title: Obtain a KIT
steps.text:
You will first need to go to the Post Office. Ask for the KIT GIALLO for the Permesso di Soggiorno, which consists of an envelope a form , and two forms. Not every Post Office has the kit, so it's better to check which Post Office does by searching "Sportello Amico Poste Italiane". The kit is free of charge. There are Post Offices next to the Academy and Central Post Office:

[Post Office near the Academy](https://goo.gl/maps/TNs54py1Hfbtsn7x8)
[Central Post Office](https://goo.gl/maps/z4Jfi1xY8tLPBfnF9)

steps.title: Buy a payment stamp
steps.text: The next step is to buy a revenue stamp, called a "Marca da Bollo". This stamp is commonly used in Italy as a proof of payment. You can get one at a tobacco shop (tabaccheria). For the permesso application it needs to me exactly €16, no more and no less. There is a place for it on the form, but you don't attach it, one of the clerks will. You just take it with you.

steps.title: Fill out the form
steps.text:
There will be 2 questionnaires in the envelope, but you only need to fill out one form - Modulo 1. You need to write in capital letters with a black pen, following the instructions included in the kit. Unfortunately the instructions are in Italian only, so you can check out the useful link below where you will find tips for filling the form out.

[Useful tips for filling out the form](http://expatalexa.com/bureaucracy-tips/fill-permesso-di-soggiorno-step-step-guide/)

steps.title: Fill out the application
steps.text: Next, you need to get another small piece of paper out of the envelope. You need to fill in the fields Name and Surname, Address, Zip Сode and Сity in Italy. You need to fill in the main part, as well as the part on the left. (<- needs to be more descriptive or have a pic)

steps.title: Make copies of documents
steps.text:
You will need to make copies of the following documents:
- Passport
- Visa
- Codice Fiscale
- Insurance policy and check (fattura) (<- what's a check?)
- Admission/enrolment letter from the Academy

steps.title: Submit you application through the Post Office
steps.text: The next step is to go to the Post Office again. Bring all the copies that you have made, along with the Marca da Bollo, the completed A4 form from step 3 and the small piece of paper from step 4 and give them all to the employee in the window. Then you pay for everything that they tell you (the cost is about €100 euros). After that you get a receipt (ricevuta) (DO NOT LOSE THIS). It tells you the date, time and address of your appointment with the police.

steps.title: Go to the Polizia
steps.text:
It is quite common for the appointment to be 1-2 months after submitting your application. You should arrive on the appointed date to [Questura](https://goo.gl/maps/WmZSkN24dExCVog36) (This is the branch that most people have their appointments, but it may be different). Take the following documents  with you:
- Ricevuta from Post Office
- Appointment details which was issued along with the richevuta
- 3x4 photos (4 photos)  (3x4 what? cm? are these standard passport photos?)
- Passport
- Original insurance policy
- Original Codice Fiscale
- Admission/enrolment letter
- Accommodation contract OR (<- The other thing)

Also bring copies of these documents. They shouldn't be required, but just in case. At the police station all the documents will be checked and your fingerprints will be taken. It is better to come to the police 40 minutes in advance, and be sure to take something to eat: you will likely be waiting a very long time.

steps.title: Go to the Polizia again to collect your Permesso
steps.text: About a month after going to the police station, you will receive an SMS saying the permesso is ready to be collected. Go to the same police whenever it is convenient. Collect your card, and start to enjoy life. The most difficult task is over!
